page.description: If the List definition specified that server-side summary values should be computed for any of the fields in the list, retrieves the summary value.

argument.name: UXListName
argument.description: The ID of the List control.

argument.name: field
argument.description: The field to fetch the summary.

argument.name: summaryType
argument.description: The type of summary to get. Can be one of the following values:

discussion.p: The *[ui:{dialog.object}.getListServerSideSummaryValue()]* method will fetch the summary value for a field. *[The list must be configured to compute summary values]* to use this method. You can configure the List to compute summary values using the [Compute summary values] server-side property.

The server-side summary value is the summary for *[all]* data in the current List query - not just the records that are currently shown in the List control. In the case of paginated Lists, the List query may have more records than are shown in the List.

description.p: To get a summary value, you must specify both the field and the summary value you want to get from the specified List. For example, the example below will get the *[js:'total']* for the *[js:'QTY']* columin in *[js:'list1']*:

section.example: //get the 'total' for the 'QTY' column in 'list1' var valueTot = {dialog.object}.getListServerSideSummaryValue('list1','QTY','total');

section.important: The summary value will only be available if you specifically requested it in the List builder.
